alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 2:54AM PDT until August 21 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Eastern and Central Ventura County. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 249 AM PDT, Local law enforcement continue to report flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen with local amounts to 6 inches in the foothills and mountains. - Although heavy rain is tapering off, normally dry washes and small creeks and streams are flowing and maybe overtopping their banks. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, Moorpark, Santa Paula, Newbury Park, Point Mugu, Lockwood Valley, and Oak Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
